meanings.definition: To act as an intermediary in negotiations or transactions.
meanings.sent1: She was brokering a deal between two companies.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys brokering agreements that benefit both sides.
meanings.sent3: The cat was brokering a peace treaty between the dogs and the birds.
meanings.sent4: His skills in brokering made him the go-to person for resolving conflicts.
meanings.sent5: Brokering requires good communication and problem-solving skills.

meanings.definition: The business of negotiating deals between parties.

meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in brokering after studying economics.

meanings.sent4: In the fast-paced world of brokering, timing is crucial.
meanings.sent5: The art of brokering involves finding common ground between conflicting parties.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging or mediating a deal or agreement.
meanings.sent1: Successful brokering requires understanding the needs of both parties.
meanings.sent2: The company specializes in international brokering services.
meanings.sent3: The children were brokering a trade of their lunch items.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for brokering led to many successful business partnerships.
